data.taskTitle: i see this 82 cols on all the sessioncards what is it
Investigate 82 cols indicator on session cards
data.approach: Identified the cols indicator is tmux column width shown on /sessions page. Will determine if it should be removed or kept as user feedback during resize.

data.taskTitle: Investigate 82 cols indicator on session cards
summary: Found 82 cols indicator is tmux column width display on /sessions page
It shows current terminal width and updates when user drags the resize handle
Implemented intentionally as user feedback during card width resizing
findings: Styled in CSS at lines 2726-2739 (positioned top-right of card)
Related to HorizontalResizeHandle component for resizing session cards
Shows tmuxWidth state variable which tracks terminal column count

data.taskTitle: Hide cols indicator except during resize
summary: Made cols indicator hidden by default with opacity: 0
Added visible class that shows indicator during resize

data.taskTitle: Show cols indicator only during card resize
summary: Added isCardResizing state to track horizontal resize
Set state true during resize, false on end
Bound indicator visibility to isCardResizing instead of wrong state

summary: Investigated the '82 cols' indicator on session cards

suggestedTasks.title: Document Purpose of Session Card Column Indicator
suggestedTasks.description: Create clear documentation explaining the '82 cols' indicator's purpose and functionality. Include details about when and why this indicator appears during session card interactions. Update relevant UI documentation or tooltips to provide clarity for users and developers.
suggestedTasks.reason: Lack of clear explanation for the column indicator

patterns: Column resize indicator during session card interactions

documentationNeeds: Update UI component documentation for session cards
